title: Welcome to My Webpage
text:
Welcome to My Webpage


HELLO
I am Monalisa de Cól, an agronomist with a passion for Plant Disease and Epidemiology. I completed my bachelor’s degree in Agronomy in 2022 and earned a master’s degree in Plant Pathology from UFV in 2023. Currently, I’m pursuing my Ph.D. in Plant Disease, focusing on epidemiological modeling, and I am guided by Dr. Emerson Medeiros Del Ponte.


Thank you for visiting my site. If you have any questions or would like to get in touch, please feel free to reach out. I appreciate your interest!
monalisacdecol@gmail.com

Recommended Reading











“R for Plant Disease Epidemiology (R4PDE)”
Written by Professor Emerson Medeiros Del Ponte, this book offers a simplified introduction to using R for quantitative epidemiology. If you’re interested in enhancing your skills in data analysis and epidemiological modeling, this book comes highly recommended.








“An Introduction to Statistical Learning”
Written by Gareth James and collaborators, this book provides a broad and less technical treatment of key topics in statistical learning. It includes code examples at the end of each chapter and offers versions for those working with both R and Python. Whether you’re a beginner or experienced in statistical learning, this book is a valuable resource to enhance your understanding.








“Study of Plant Disease Epidemics”
Written by Madden and collaborators, this book provides comprehensive coverage of plant epidemiology, from basic concepts to more advanced topics. Whether you are new to the field or looking to delve into complex issues, this book offers valuable insights into the study of plant disease epidemics.

title: Home
text:
High Academic Achievement During my master’s program, I achieved an outstanding academic performance, earning a coefficient above 87. This achievement allowed me to defend my master’s thesis within a year and a half and gain direct admission to the Ph.D. program without the need for a selection process.



Master’s Degree (2022-2023)
I began my master’s journey in March 2022 and successfully obtained my degree on July 27, 2023. During my master’s program, I conducted research titled “Weather-Based Logistic Regression Models for Predicting the Risk of Wheat Blast Epidemics.” My thesis committee included Dr. Franklin Machado, Felipe Dalla Lana, and my advisor.




First-Place Award for Best Research Work - Brazilian Congress of Plant Pathology
After successfully defending my master’s thesis, my research was selected for presentation and nominated for the “Best Master’s Work” award category at the Brazilian Congress of Plant Pathology. I am honored to have received the first-place award for the best research work in this category.
